tweet: I voted against the resolution because the American people deserve transparent and fair proceedings.

H.Res.660 greenlights a flawed, unprecedented process that gives Chairman Schiff complete control, continues to limit the ability of Republicans to fully participate in hearings, and denies basic due process rights to the president and his counsel.

I will not vote to rubberstamp the House Democrats' closed-door impeachment hearings. The process approved today by House Democrats keeps Members of Congress and the millions of Americans they represent in the dark.
@ZoeLofgren @CongMikeSimpson @RepJimmyPanetta @RepLaMalfa @MarioDB

The FORESTS Act is a step in the right direction toward utilizing and celebrating our nation's forests and forest products - something we should do more of! Learn more here:  https://mcmorris.house.gov/mcmorris-rodgers-newhouse-introduce-forests-act-to-reduce-the-risk-of-wildfire-and-protect-timber-dependent-communities/¬†‚Ä¶ #ForestProductsWeek

Earlier this year, @cathymcmorris and I introduced the FORESTS Act, encouraging public-private partnerships to responsibly manage our forests & reauthorizing the Secure Rural Schools program to redirect timber revenue to rural schools, roads & communities. #ForestProductsWeek

By actively managing our forests, we combat the risk of catastrophic wildfires facing #WA04 and the West. By harvesting and planting more trees, we provide clean oxygen and better air quality for both communities and wildlife. #ForestProductsWeek
National Forest Products Week is an opportunity to recognize the value of American forest products & commit to responsible management of U.S. forests. #ForestProductsWeek pic.twitter.com/KPmuHDH9IK

As former heads of our state agriculture departments, Rep. @kycomer, @RepJohnRose, and I bring unique experience to Congress. While WA, KY, & TN agriculture may be vastly different, the fact remains: We rely on Canada and Mexico. American farmers & ranchers need the #USMCANow.

In the words of @RepDustyJohnson, "Every one of us here tonight knows we can do better." Thank you to my colleagues for participating to bring attention and urge action on this important issue facing the United States. Congress must act to #EndMMIW.

On behalf of the Native communities, families, and loved ones in #WA04, I know we must take action. Savanna's Act and the BADGES for Native Communities Act would provide immediate relief to tribal communities & law enforcement who face this crisis every day.

@RepDustyJohnson (R-SD): "In just the last few years, we have had 6000 Native American women go missing...and just a handful of those cases have been logged with the Dept. of Justice. In that way, our federal government is not doing enough to combat this problem." #EndMMIW

@RepDonBacon (R-NE): "We say we would go to the ends of the earth to protect our family, our friends, & our loved ones. That is how our Native American brothers and sisters feel about their lost loved ones as well...When our fellow Americans go missing, we take action." #EndMMIW

@RepTorresSmall (D-NM): "New Mexico‚Äôs past, present, and future is tied to the vibrancy of its Native American sovereign governments. One of the most serious threats facing these communities is the crisis of murdered and missing women." #EndMMIW
"This is absolutely the purview of Congress. This bill has broad bipartisan and bicameral support, and there's really no excuse to not get Savanna's Act passed." -@RepArmstrongND (R-ND) #EndMMIW

@RepArmstrongND represents North Dakota, where Savanna LaFontaine-Greywind, a member of the Spirit Lake Tribe and the namesake of Savanna's Act, lived and was tragically murdered. #EndMMIW pic.twitter.com/YUH1epILrW

@NormaJTorres (D-CA): "Because of the efforts of Native American women across the country, we are close to passing Savanna's Act into law. But we cannot continue waiting. More importantly, Native American women cannot afford it." #EndMMIW
Pictured here: Kaysera Stops Pretty Places, an 18-year-old woman from Montana whose death still remains a mystery. #EndMMIW pic.twitter.com/34PI939kW1

Rep. Gianforte (R-MT): "This tragic epidemic must end. These are our sisters, our daughters, our granddaughters. Their cases often do not receive the attention they deserve. Their families deserve justice. #EndMMIW
HAPPENING NOW: I am hosting a Special Order on the House floor to urge Congress to act and end the crisis of missing and murdered indigenous women. #EndMMIW pic.twitter.com/agtGbQMdoJ
